bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 66 (Thursday, April 20, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. BOEBERT:H.R. 2746.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:The Congress shall have Power To lay and collect Taxes,Duties, Imposts and Excises, to pay the Debts and provide forthe common Defence and general Welfare of the United States;but all Duties, Imposts and Excises shall be uniformthroughout the United States;The single subject of this legislation is:Directs the Secretary of the Army to utilize the standardBRAC process to carry out the closure and subsequent relatedproperty management and disposal of the Pueblo ChemicalDepot.[Page H1910]

item.title: Promoting Utilization and Economic Benefits from Land Optimization (PUEBLO) Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024

latestAction.text: Senate ordered measure printed as passed.

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024

latestAction.text: The Speaker appointed conferees - from the Committee on Veterans' Affairs for consideration of secs. 571, 572, 579, 1118, 1413, 1733, and 1885 of the House bill, and secs. 1084, 1090B, 1521, 1833, 1852, 6071, 6077, and 11020 of the Senate amendment, and modifications committed to conference: Bost, Luttrell, and Takano.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

bill.title: Pueblo Jobs Act

item.title: To provide for the closure and disposal of the Pueblo Chemical Depot, Pueblo County, Colorado.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
